thread.title: Girls tennis: Batavia doubles team earns rare sectional title
thread.title_full: Girls tennis: Batavia doubles team earns rare sectional title

author: Bill Bruton Jr. bbruton@batavianews.com
title: Girls tennis: Batavia doubles team earns rare sectional title
text:
Larger font size Posted: Monday, October 19, 2015 1:59 am Girls tennis: Batavia doubles team earns rare sectional title By Bill Bruton Jr. bbruton@batavianews.com   
Batavia’s doubles team of Stephanie Hoy and Sophia Stewart accomplished something over the weekend that hadn’t been done since the Reagan Administration — and maybe longer. 
The BHS duo downed the top-seeded team from Palmyra-Macedon, Marietta Koeberle and Anna O’Donnell, 4-6, 6-1, 6-4 in the title match to claim the Section 5 Class B doubles championship at the Mendon Raquet and Pool Club. 
Batavia coach Kevin Walkowski said it’s been at least 30 years since anyone from the girls tennis team at Batavia has won an individual or doubles championship. 
“They played exceptional,” Walkowski said. “They showed heart. They maneuvered their opponents all over the court.” 
A critical point came in the third set. Hoy and Stewart, the third seeds, had been winning the set 4-1 before losing the next two games. The next point went to deuce a few times before the BHS duo prevailed. Pal-Mac won one more game before Hoy and Stewart sealed the deal. 
“It was an excellent job by those two kids,” Walkowski said. 
Lea Morgan and Ariana Ross also made it to state qualifiers in the playbacks by beating the second-seeded duo of Ashley Porter and Kathryn Pieters of Newark 4-6, 6-4, 6-2. 
In singles, Batavia’s Melissa Mountain lost to Pal-Mac’s Cara Graham 6-1, 6-4 in playbacks. 
“Melissa played an excellent, excellent (match) against her,” Walkowski said. “It was just a little bit too much to overcome.”
